java/liquibase/change/DropSequenceChange.java

00001 package liquibase.change;
00002 
00003 import liquibase.database.Database;
00004 import liquibase.database.sql.DropSequenceStatement;
00005 import liquibase.database.sql.SqlStatement;
00006 import liquibase.database.structure.DatabaseObject;
00007 import liquibase.database.structure.Sequence;
00008 import liquibase.exception.UnsupportedChangeException;
00009 import org.w3c.dom.Document;
00010 import org.w3c.dom.Element;
00011 
00012 import java.util.Arrays;
00013 import java.util.HashSet;
00014 import java.util.Set;
00015 
00019 public class DropSequenceChange extends AbstractChange {
00020 
00021     private String schemaName;
00022     private String sequenceName;
00023 
00024     public DropSequenceChange() {
00025         super("dropSequence", "Drop Sequence");
00026     }
00027 
00028     public String getSchemaName() {
00029         return schemaName;
00030     }
00031 
00032     public void setSchemaName(String schemaName) {
00033         this.schemaName = schemaName;
00034     }
00035 
00036     public String getSequenceName() {
00037         return sequenceName;
00038     }
00039 
00040     public void setSequenceName(String sequenceName) {
00041         this.sequenceName = sequenceName;
00042     }
00043 
00044     public SqlStatement[] generateStatements(Database database) throws UnsupportedChangeException {
00045         return new SqlStatement[]{new DropSequenceStatement(getSchemaName() == null?database.getDefaultSchemaName():getSchemaName(), getSequenceName())};
00046     }
00047 
00048     public String getConfirmationMessage() {
00049         return "Sequence " + getSequenceName() + " dropped";
00050     }
00051 
00052     public Element createNode(Document currentChangeLogFileDOM) {
00053         Element element = currentChangeLogFileDOM.createElement("dropSequence");
00054         if (getSchemaName() != null) {
00055             element.setAttribute("schemaName", getSchemaName());
00056         }
00057         element.setAttribute("sequenceName", getSequenceName());
00058 
00059         return element;
00060     }
00061 
00062     public Set<DatabaseObject> getAffectedDatabaseObjects() {
00063         Sequence dbObject = new Sequence();
00064         dbObject.setName(sequenceName);
00065 
00066         return new HashSet<DatabaseObject>(Arrays.asList(dbObject));
00067     }
00068 }
